result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Peltrion Idris Banks

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Peltrion Idris Banks in court.  Attorney Ashley Fard in court for Peltrion Idris Banks.  Attorney Chad Wozniak in court for State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm 
Case calendared for Return on Doctor Report this date.  Defendant contesting the findings.  Court adjourns matter for Competency Hearing.  Parties are advised that effective 10/31/2022, pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-17, this case will be reassigned to Branch 34, Judge Yamahiro in Room 423 of the Safety Building.
Competency hearing scheduled for December 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Competency Report received and filed.  bm
No Contact Order and Keep Separate Order signed and filed.  bm
Order for Examination Under Section 971.16, Wis. Stats. (Not Guilty by Reason of Mental Disease or Defect) signed and filed.  bm

Defendant Peltrion Idris Banks in court, in custody.  Attorney Colleen Taylor for Ashley Fard in court for Peltrion Idris Banks.  Attorney Jennifer Jean Tate in court for State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk:  bm 

Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court ordered defendant to be examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.   Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Court ordered Defendant to be kept separate from Co-Defendant Laprada Cross.
Doctor's Report Return scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Ashley Fard in court, defendant Peltrion Idris Banks not in court, in custody.  Jennifer Jean Tate appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
Scheduling Conference held.  Defense requests an adjourned scheduling conference date.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Peltrion Idris Banks in court, appear by video with attorney Ashley Fard, appear in person.  Defendant Peltrion Idris Banks in custody.  Jennifer Tate appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Court took Judical Notice to case 20CF1377. Sworn for the State: Detective J. Sokolowski.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 12.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
State Public Defender - Order Appointing Counsel.  Received and Filed.  nk

Defendant Peltrion Idris Banks not in court, defendant in custody.  Jennifer Jean Tate appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for preliminary hearing. State witness present. SPD to appoint Attorney Fard pending a conflict check. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring. 24 hour curfew with the exception of verified legal appointments. If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, bail to revert to $250,000.00.  If Alternative bail is paid, Defendant to be released and placed on Electronic Monitoring waiting list.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Peltrion Idris Banks in court with attorney Amanda M. Parent.  Defendant Peltrion Idris Banks in custody.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Peltrion Idris Banks appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Borowski, Branch 12.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a Preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.   DEFENDANT QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
